docs.lead_paragraph: If you're interested in a reading a just-the-facts analysis of the health care legislation pending in Congress, here's your chance.

headline.main: A Crib Sheet on the Health Care Bills

docs.lead_paragraph: MoveOn.org has created a new ad in support of the public option that features a fit Heather Graham in running clothes, sprinting against overindulgent insurance company representatives.

headline.main: Heather Graham Sprints for the Public Option

docs.abstract: A new MoveOn.org ad in support of the public option features a fit Heather Graham sprinting against overindulgent insurance company representatives.
docs.snippet: A new MoveOn.org ad in support of the public option features a fit Heather Graham sprinting against overindulgent insurance company representatives.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House Judiciary Committee on Wednesday approved a bill that would curb the health insurance industry's limited exemption from federal antitrust laws and would allow Justice Department enforcement in the areas of price-fixing and market allocation.

headline.main: House Panel Approves Bill Curbing Insurers' Antitrust Exemption

docs.abstract: The House Judiciary Committee tightens the health insurance industry's limited exemption from federal antitrust laws.
docs.snippet: The House Judiciary Committee tightens the health insurance industry's limited exemption from federal antitrust laws.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 6:02 p.m. | Anthony S. Seminerio, a longtime Democratic assemblyman from Queens who resigned in June just before pleading guilty to fraud charges, was involved in a widespread web of corruption that extended further than had been previously acknowledged, according to court documents released this week [pdf].

headline.main: Ex-Assemblyman Portrayed as Corrupt on a Vast Scale

docs.abstract: Prosecutors say that Anthony S. Seminerio used his official position as an assemblyman to try to illegally enrich himself by seeking payments from various people and entities with business before the state.
docs.snippet: Prosecutors say that Anthony S. Seminerio used his official position as an assemblyman to try to illegally enrich himself by seeking payments from various people and entities with business before the state.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the first set of answers from Joshua B. Freeman, a historian and the author of "Working-Class New York: Life and Labor Since World War II" (The New Press, 2000).

headline.main: Answers About the History of New York's Working Class

docs.abstract: Taking Questions: Joshua B. Freeman, a historian and the author of "Working-Class New York: Life and Labor Since World War II," responds to readers.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: Joshua B. Freeman, a historian and the author of "Working-Class New York: Life and Labor Since World War II," responds to readers.

docs.lead_paragraph: If further study finds that a retroviral infection actually causes chronic fatigue syndrome, it may finally open doors for a new treatment for this highly debated malady.
docs.snippet: If further study finds that a retroviral infection actually causes chronic fatigue syndrome, it may finally open doors for a new treatment for this highly debated malady.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most powerful voices in the health care debate — President Obama’s — has grown noticeably quieter.

headline.main: Obama Takes a Health Care Hiatus
headline.print_headline: Obama Takes a Health Care Hiatus

docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Democrats backed down from their effort to increase Medicare payments to doctors without offsetting any of the cost over the next 10 years.

headline.main: Senate Democrats Hit Snag With Doctor Payment Bill
headline.print_headline: Senate Democrats Hit Snag With Doctor Payment Bill

docs.snippet: Senate Democrats backed down from their effort to increase Medicare payments to doctors without offsetting any of the cost over the next 10 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate Finance Committee has quietly recommended that the millions of elderly Americans who buy so-called Medigap insurance plans be charged new co-payments for doctors' visits starting in 2015. Consumer advocates predict that the changes, proposed in the committee's 1,500-page health care bill, will meet stiff opposition from lobbyists for the elderly as the final version of the legislation takes shape.
docs.abstract: Senate Finance Committee's proposed health care bill includes provision that would require millions of elderly Americans who buy so-called Medigap insurance plans to pay new co-payment for visits to doctor, staring in 2015 (M)
docs.snippet: The Senate Finance Committee has quietly recommended that the millions of elderly Americans who buy so-called Medigap insurance plans be charged new co-payments for doctors' visits starting in 2015.      Consumer advocates predict that the changes,...

docs.lead_paragraph: The health insurance industry may have envisioned a low-key wonk session when it planned its ''state issues'' annual conference this year. But the conference, scheduled for Thursday and Friday in Washington, comes at a crucial phase of the battle over health care legislation. The event could prove more lively than expected, with protesters planning to show up in droves.
docs.abstract: Health insurance industry's annual 'state issues' conference could prove more lively than expected because it comes at crucial phase of battle over health care legislation and protesters are planning to show up in droves (M)
